cyclone.name: MARCO
cyclone.current_location: about 30 mi NNE of Cabo Gracias a Dios on the Nicaragua / Honduras border
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to move northwest, cross the Yucatán Peninsula Saturday night, then turn north-northwest across the central Gulf of Mexico toward the Louisiana coast early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Louisiana coast (near or just east of the mouth of the Mississippi River)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Punta Herrero to Cancún, Mexico (Hurricane Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Honduras/Nicaragua border westward to Punta Castilla, Bay Islands of Honduras, Puerto Cabezas northward to the Honduras/Nicaragua border, and Punta Herrero to Cancún (Tropical Storm Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from southeastern Texas across Louisiana and Mississippi
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 mph) possible around 25 Aug
weather_observation.storm_surge: Elevated water levels of 2–4 ft above ground level possible along the lower Mississippi River and adjacent coast
weather_observation.rainfall: Potential for 4–8 inches of rain with localized higher amounts, leading to flash and river flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Port operations may be affected by river flooding, reduced visibility in squalls, and possible brief tornadoes in outer rainbands
